name: GetEnterpriseTeamMembers
description:
Retrieve team members for an enterprise organization team.

This tool retrieves the list of team members for a specific team within an enterprise organization on Miro. It should be used when needing to access the team member details for organizational purposes. This tool is only available to users with an Enterprise plan and the role of Company Admin.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization whose team members are being retrieved.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the team whose members are being retrieved.

parameters.name: member_retrieval_limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of team members to retrieve in one call. Leave empty for default.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: Indicates the page position for fetching results. Leave empty for the first page or use the value from the previous cursor field for subsequent pages.

value_schema.description: An indicator of the position of a page in the full set of results. To obtain the first page leave it empty. To obtain subsequent pages set it to the value returned in the cursor field of the previous request.

parameters.name: filter_by_role
parameters.description: Filter team members by their role. Accepted values: 'member', 'admin', 'non_team', 'team_guest'.

value_schema.description:
Role query. Filters members by role using full word match. Accepted values are:
* "member":     Team member with full member permissions.
* "admin":      Admin of a team. Team member with permission to manage team.
* "non_team":   External user, non-team user.
* "team_guest": Team-guest user, user with access only to a team without access to organization.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the miro API.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: An indicator of the position of a page in the full set of results. To obtain the first page leave it empty. To obtain subsequent pages set it to the value returned in the cursor field of the previous request.

value_schema.description: An indicator of the position of a page in the full set of results. To obtain the first page leave it empty. To obtain subsequent pages set it to the value returned in the cursor field of the previous request.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description:
Role query. Filters members by role using full word match. Accepted values are:
* "member":     Team member with full member permissions.
* "admin":      Admin of a team. Team member with permission to manage team.
* "non_team":   External user, non-team user.
* "team_guest": Team-guest user, user with access only to a team without access to organization.

value_schema.description:
Role query. Filters members by role using full word match. Accepted values are:
* "member":     Team member with full member permissions.
* "admin":      Admin of a team. Team member with permission to manage team.
* "non_team":   External user, non-team user.
* "team_guest": Team-guest user, user with access only to a team without access to organization.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
